definition: Arbor Day (March 12th), also known as National Tree Planting Day 全民義務植樹日|全民义务植树日[Quan2 min2 Yi4 wu4 Zhi2 shu4 ri4]
see 節骨眼|节骨眼[jie1 gu5 yan3]
festival/holiday/node/joint/section/segment/part/to economize/to save/to abridge/moral integrity/classifier for segments, e.g. lessons, train wagons, biblical verses/CL:個|个[ge4]

sentences.english: Not all the students went to plant trees on Tree Planting Day.
sentences.chinese: 植树节那天并非所有的学生都去栽树了。

sentences.english: In different countries, Planting Trees Days are on different days.
sentences.chinese: 在不同国家，植树节在不同的日子。

sentences.english: Today is Arbor Day What are you going to do?
sentences.chinese: 今天是植树节，你有什么打算吗？

sentences.english: Last Arbor Day I planted two trees.
sentences.chinese: 上年的植树节，我种了两棵树。

sentences.english: As years go by, Arbor Day has become of the major holidays in America.
sentences.chinese: 随着时间流逝，植树节已经成为美国的主要节日之一。

sentences.english: Later on, each American state started to celebrate Arbor Day.
sentences.chinese: 后来，其它州也跟进，开始庆祝植树节。

sentences.english: Today is Arbor Day. What are you going to do?
sentences.chinese: 今天是植树节，你有什么打算吗？

sentences.english: In China, Planting Trees Day is on March 12.

definition: Teachers' Day (September 10th in PRC and Confucius's birthday, September 28th in Taiwan)
Youth Day (May 4th), PRC national holiday for young people aged 14 to 28, who get half a day off
Children's Day (June 1st), PRC national holiday for children under 14
Double Ninth or Yang Festival/9th day of 9th lunar month
Qingming or Pure Brightness Festival or Tomb Sweeping Day, celebration for the dead (in early April)
Dragon Boat Festival (5th day of the 5th lunar month)
